22 // offsets

24 #define O_Y (1)
25 #define O_THETA (2)
26 #define O_TARGET (nRobots_ * nStatesPerRobot_)

28 #define O_TY (1)
29 #define O_TZ (2)

44 typedef struct odometry_s

49 typedef struct landmarkObs_s
50 {
51  bool found;
52  double x, y;
53  double d, phi;
54  double covDD, covPP, covXX, covYY;
55  landmarkObs_s() { found = false; }
56 } LandmarkObservation;
57 
58 typedef struct targetObs_s
59 {
60  bool found;
61  double x, y, z;
62  double d, phi;
63  double covDD, covPP, covXX, covYY;
64 
65  targetObs_s() { found = false; }
66 } TargetObservation;

68 // Apply concept of subparticles (the particle set for each dimension)

70 typedef std::vector<pdata_t> subparticles_t;
71 typedef std::vector<subparticles_t> particles_t;

76 class ParticleFilter
77 {
78 protected:
83  struct State
84  {
85  uint nRobots;
86  const std::vector<bool>& robotsUsed;
87  std::vector<bool> predicted;
88  std::vector<bool> landmarkMeasurementsDone;
89  std::vector<bool> targetMeasurementsDone;
90  bool targetPredicted;
91  bool robotsFused;
92  bool targetFused;
93  bool resampled;
94 
99  struct robotState_s
100  {
101  float x, y, theta;
102  float conf;
103  };
104  std::vector<struct robotState_s> robots;

110  struct targetState_s
111  {
112  float x, y, z;
113  float vx, vy, vz;

115 
120  State(const uint numberRobots, const std::vector<bool>& robotsBeingUsed)
121  : nRobots(numberRobots), predicted(nRobots, false),
122  landmarkMeasurementsDone(nRobots, false),
123  targetMeasurementsDone(nRobots, false), robots(nRobots),
124  robotsUsed(robotsBeingUsed)
125  {
126  reset();
127  }
128 
129  private:
130  void print(std::ostringstream& oss, std::vector<bool>& vec)
131  {
132  oss << "[";
133 
134  for (std::vector<bool>::iterator it = vec.begin(); it != vec.end(); ++it)
135  oss << *it;
136 
137  oss << "]";
138  return;
139  }
140 
141  public:
142  void print()
143  {
144  std::ostringstream oss;
145  oss << "PF State:";
146  oss << std::endl
147  << "-predicted = ";
148  print(oss, predicted);
149  oss << std::endl
150  << "-landmarkMeasurementsDone = ";
151  print(oss, landmarkMeasurementsDone);
152  oss << std::endl
153  << "-targetMeasurementsDone = ";
154  print(oss, targetMeasurementsDone);
155  oss << std::endl
156  << "-targetPredicted = " << targetPredicted;
157  oss << std::endl
158  << "-robotsFused = " << robotsFused;
159  oss << std::endl
160  << "-targetFused = " << targetFused;
161  oss << std::endl
162  << "-resampled = " << resampled;
163 
164  ROS_DEBUG("%s", oss.str().c_str());
165  }
166 
171  void reset()
172  {
173  predicted.assign(nRobots, false);
174  landmarkMeasurementsDone.assign(nRobots, false);
175  targetMeasurementsDone.assign(nRobots, false);
176  robotsFused = targetFused = resampled = targetPredicted = false;
177 
178  for (uint r = 0; r < nRobots; ++r)
179  {
180  if (!robotsUsed[r])
181  {
182  predicted[r] = true;
183  landmarkMeasurementsDone[r] = true;
184  targetMeasurementsDone[r] = true;
185  }
186  }
187  }
188 
195  bool allPredicted()
196  {
197  for (std::vector<bool>::iterator it = predicted.begin();
198  it != predicted.end(); ++it)
199  {
200  if (false == *it)
201  return false;
202  }
203 
204  return true;
205  }
206 
212  bool allLandmarkMeasurementsDone()
213  {
214  for (std::vector<bool>::iterator it = landmarkMeasurementsDone.begin();
215  it != landmarkMeasurementsDone.end(); ++it)
216  {
217  if (false == *it)
218  return false;
219  }
220 
221  return true;
222  }
223 
229  bool allTargetMeasurementsDone()
230  {
231  for (std::vector<bool>::iterator it = targetMeasurementsDone.begin();
232  it != targetMeasurementsDone.end(); ++it)
233  {
234  if (false == *it)
235  return false;
236  }
237 
238  return true;
239  }
240  };
241 
242 public:
247  struct PFinitData
248  {
249  const uint nParticles, nTargets, statesPerRobot, nRobots, nLandmarks;
250  const std::vector<bool>& robotsUsed;
251  const std::vector<Landmark>& landmarksMap;
252  std::vector<float> alpha;
253 
267  PFinitData(const uint _nParticles, const uint _nTargets,
268  const uint _statesPerRobot, const uint _nRobots,
269  const uint _nLandmarks, const std::vector<bool>& _robotsUsed,
270  const std::vector<Landmark>& _landmarksMap,
271  const std::vector<float> _alpha = std::vector<float>())
272  : nParticles(_nParticles), nTargets(_nTargets),
273  statesPerRobot(_statesPerRobot), nRobots(_nRobots),
274  nLandmarks(_nLandmarks), alpha(_alpha), robotsUsed(_robotsUsed),
275  landmarksMap(_landmarksMap)
276  {
277  // If vector alpha is not provided, use a default one
278  if (alpha.empty())
279  {
280  for (int r = 0; r < nRobots; ++r)
281  {
282  alpha.push_back(0.015);
283  alpha.push_back(0.1);
284  alpha.push_back(0.5);
285  alpha.push_back(0.001);
286  }
287  }
288 
289  // Check size of vector alpha
290  if (alpha.size() != 4 * nRobots)
291  {
292  ROS_ERROR(
293  "The provided vector alpha is not of the correct size. Returning "
294  "without particle filter! (should have %d=nRobots*4 elements)",
295  nRobots * 4);
296  return;
297  }
298  }
299  };
300

373  void updateIterationTime(ros::Time tRos)
374  {
375  prevTime_ = newTime_;
376  newTime_ = tRos;
377  iterationTime_ = (newTime_-prevTime_).toNSec()*1e-9;
378  if(fabs(iterationTime_) > 10)
379  {
380  // Something is wrong, set to default iteration time
381  iterationTime_ = ITERATION_TIME_DEFAULT;
382  }
383  ROS_DEBUG("Target tracking iteration time: %f", iterationTime_);
384  }

421  {
422  return particles_[index];
423  }
